item.description:
I will be attending this reading at River Run tomorrow night. If anyone else is interested in meeting up beforehand/during/after please let me know.

This is what prompted the article in last weeks WIRE magazine.

If you have not read the article yet it is available to read online now. Larry did a great job. Link: http://bit.ly/CPUtx...

Info from River Run's Website:

"Wednesday, September 2, 2009 - 7:00pm
Ethan Gilsdorf, author with local roots, reads from FANTASY FREAKS AND GAMING GEEKS

This fun event will include: a trivia contest with prizes; prizes for anyone arriving in costume as his or her favorite fantasy character or creature (elf, orc, warrior, wizard, Harry Potter, etc); a reading, Q&A and book signing; and a reception with snacks and beverages. Writer Ethan Gilsdorf grew up in Lee and went to Oyster River High School.

Fantasy. Science fiction. Role-playing games. People around the globe turn away from the “real” world to inhabit others. Movie fan-freaks design costumes and collect Lord of the Rings action figures. Some attend comic book conventions and Renaissance fairs, others play live-action role-playing games (LARPs). The online game World of Warcraft (WoW) has lured twelve million users worldwide. Even old-school role-playing games such as Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) are still wildly popular."

Read the whole thing here at : http://bit.ly/ra16t...
item.how_to_find_us: Red or Blue Shirt with Sages Logo on it. Tan Ballcap.

group.name: The Portsmouth, NH / Seacoast Boardgames Group

item.name: Ethan Gilsdorf, author, reads from FANTASY FREAKS AND GAMING GEEKS
